materials: RED HEART® Soft Baby Steps®: 1 ball each 9600 White A, 9700 Baby Pink OR 9800 Baby Blue B
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, B, C
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated.
measurements: Bootie measures 4½” [11.5cm] long x 2” [5cm] wide
gauge: 20 sts = 4” [10 cm] in single crochet. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Shape Ankle 
Row 1: Skip first 34 sc of last round, join A in next sc, ch 1, sc in same sc, hdc in next 26 sc, sc in next sc – 28 sts. 
Row 2: Ch 1, turn, sc2tog, sc in next 6 sts, [sc2tog] twice, sc in next 4 sts, [sc2tog] twice, sc in next 6 sts, sc2tog – 22 sts. Fasten off. 
Shape Toe 
Row 1: Skip next 7 sts of last complete round of Bootie Upper, join A in next st, ch 1, sc in same st, sc in next 6 sc – 7 sc. 
Row 2: Ch 1, turn, sc in each sc, sc in next skipped sc along complete round – 8 sc. 
Row 3: Ch 1, turn, sc in each 8 sc, sc in next skipped sc along complete round – 9 sc. 
Rows 4-8: Ch 1, turn, sc in each sc. 
Row 9: Ch 1, turn, sc2tog, sc in each sc to last 2 sc, sc2tog – 7 sts. Fasten off. 
Finishing 
Following Crown Chart and using B, embroider Crown in center of Toe in cross stitch. Sew edges of Toe and Ankle pieces together. Weave in ends. 
SPECIAL ABBREVIATIONS 
sc2tog: [Insert hook in next st, yarn over, draw yarn through st] twice, yarn over, draw yarn through 3 loops on hook. 
BOOTIES 
Sole 
With B, ch 13. 
Round 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next 10 ch, 3 sc in last ch, turn to work along opposite edge of foundation ch, sc in 10 ch, 3 sc in last ch, slip st in first sc to join – 27 sc. Place marker for beginning of round. 
Round 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in same st, *sc in next 10 sc, 2 sc in next 3 sts; repeat from * once more, slip st in first sc – 34 sc. 
Round 3: Ch 1, 2 sc in same st, 2 sc in next st, sc in next 9 sts, hdc in next 2 sts, 2 hdc in next 5 sts, hdc in next 2 sts, sc in next 9 sts, 2 sc in next 2 sts, sc in next 3 sts, slip st in first sc – 43 sts. 
Round 4: Ch 1, 2 sc in same st, 2 sc in next 2 sts, sc in next 11 sts, hdc in next 3 sts, [2 hdc in next st, hdc in next 3 sts] twice, sc in next 13 sts, 2 sc in next 2 sts, sc in next 3 sts, slip st in first sc – 50 sts. 
Round 5: Ch 2 (counts as hdc here and throughout), working in back loops only, hdc in each st around, slip st in top of beginning ch. Fasten off. 
Bootie Upper 
Round 1: Join A in same st as joining, ch 1, working in back loops only, sc in each st around to last 2 sts, sc2tog – 49 sts. 
Rounds 2-3: Ch 1, sc in each sc around, slip st in first sc. 
Fasten off.

materials: Red Heart® Baby Sheen™: 1 skein 0700 Pink.
2 Pink ½” (13 mm) buttons with shank, sewing needle and matching thread, Yarn needle.
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Booties measure 4” (4½”) along length of foot.
gauge: 5 dc = 1”. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain gauge.
instructions:
RIGHT BOOTIE
Ch 15 (17).
Round 1: 2 hdc in third ch from hook; hdc in each of next 11 (13) chs, 3 hdc in last ch; working on the opposite side of the same chs, hdc in each of next 11 (13) chs; sl st into the second ch – 28 (32) hdc.
Round 2: Ch 2 (count as hdc), hdc in same sp; 2 hdc in each of next 2 hdc, dc in each of next 11 (13) hdc, 2 hdc in each of next 3 hdc, dc in each of next 11 (13) hdc; sl st into the second ch – 34 (38) sts.
Round 3: Ch 2 (count as hdc), hdc in same sp; 2 hdc in each of next 5 hdc, dc in each of next 11 (13) dc, 2 hdc in each of next 6 hdc, dc in each of next 11 (13) dc; sl st into the second ch – 46 (50) sts.
Round 4: BPhdc in each st around. Do not join – 46 (50) hdc.
Rounds 5-6: Hdc in every hdc around.
Round 7: Hdc in each of the next 21 (23) hdc, 7 hdc2tog in next 14 hdc, hdc in each of the next 11 (13) hdc.
Round 8: Hdc in each of next 21 (23) hdc, 4 hdc2tog in next 8 hdc decreases, hdc in next 9 (11) hdc. Fasten off.
T-strap
Attach yarn to the center front st; ch 5.
Row 1: Sc in second ch from hook, sc in each of next 3 chs, slip st into the same st as the attachment – 4 sc.
Fasten off.
Strap
Row 1: Starting from the T-strap, skip next 7 (9) sts; attach yarn to next st, ch 2, hdc in next 19 (21) sts, ch 6; sc in the side of each of next 2 sts at the top of the T-strap, ch 12; turn – 40 (42) sts.
Row 2: Skip next 6 ch for buttonhole loop; sc in next 32 (34) sts. Fasten off.
LEFT BOOTIE
Work same as Right Bootie. Work Strap as follows:
Row 1: With wrong side facing and starting from the T-strap, skip next 7 (9) sts; attach yarn to next st, ch 2, hdc in next 19 (21) sts, ch 6, sc in the side of each of next 2 sts at the top of the T-strap, ch 12; turn – 40 (42) sts.
Row 2: Skip next 6 ch for buttonhole loop; sc in next 32 (34) sts. Fasten off.
Sew button at the edge of ankle of the bootie.
Weave in ends.

materials: Size 4 mm (U.S. G/6) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: to fit baby size 3-6 mos.
gauge: 16 hdc and 11 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
note: turning ch 2 does not count as hdc.
Ch 29.
1st row: (rS). 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each ch across.
27 hdc. turn.
2nd to 5th rows: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc across. turn.
6th row: Sl st in each of first 6 hdc. Ch 2. 1 hdc in same st as last
sl st. 1 hdc in each of next 16 hdc. turn. Leave rem 5 hdc unworked.
7th to 11th rows: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc across. turn. 17 hdc.
Place marker at each end of 9th row. Do not turn at end of
11th row.
12th row: Ch 1. Working from left to right, instead of from right to
left as usual, work 1 reverse sc in each hdc across. Fasten off.
FInIshInG
Fold Bootie in half with rS facing each other. Join yarn with sl st
at marked row and work 1 row of sc through both thicknesses to
join seam down rem of cuff, around toe and across bottom of foot.
Fasten off. turn Bootie right side out. Fold down cuff.
tie: Make a chain 12" [30.5 cm] long. Weave through 7th row of
cuff.

materials: RED HEART® Baby Econo®, 1 skein 1224 Baby Yellow or 1802 Baby Blue
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
measurements: Bootie measures 1½” (3.8 cm) x 4” (10 cm)
gauge: 16 sc = 4” (10 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain gauge.
instructions:
Right Bootie Strap
Ch 13; with Wrong Side facing, sc in 5th st BEFORE center back st, sc in next 10 sc; turn – 24 sts.
Next row: Ch 1, sc in next 11 sc, sc in each ch to end, ch 3, slip st in last sc made (button loop created).
Fasten off.

Left Bootie Strap
With Wrong Side facing, join yarn with sc in 5th st BEFORE center back st, sc in next 10 sc, ch 17; turn – 28 sts.
Next row: Sc in 4th ch from hook (button loop created) and in each st across – 24 sc. 
Fasten off.

FINISHING
Sew on buttons onto each side of strap. Weave in ends. 

BOOTIES
Sole (Make 2)
Ch 9.
Round 1: Sc in second ch from hook, 2 sc in next ch, sc in next ch, hdc in next 2 ch, dc in next 2 ch, 7 dc in last ch; working on opposite side of beginning ch, dc in next 2 ch, hdc in next 2 ch, sc in next ch, 2 sc in next ch; join with slip st in first sc – 22 sts.
Round 2: Ch 2 (counts as first st), [2 hdc in next sc] 3 times, hdc in next 4 sts, [2 hdc in next dc] 3 times, 3 hdc in next dc, [2 hdc in next dc] 3 times, hdc in next 4 sts, [2 hdc in next sc] 3 times; join with slip st in ch-2; mark ch-2 as center back st – 36 sts.
Fasten off.

Upper (Make 2)
Ch 24; join with slip st in first ch to form ring, taking care not to twist chain.
Round 1: Ch 1, sc in first 10 ch, [2 sc in next ch] twice, sc in next ch, [2 sc in next ch] twice, sc in last 9 ch; join with slip st in first sc – 28 sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, sc in first sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in next 8 sc, [2 sc in next sc, sc in next sc] twice, 3 sc in next sc, [sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] twice, sc in next 8 sc, 2 sc in last sc; join with slip st in first st – 36 sc.
Round 3: Ch 1, sc in each sc around; join with slip st in first st.
Round 4: With Wrong Sides of Upper and Sole together and sts aligned, ch 1, slip st in each st around; join with slip st in first st. 
Fasten off. Weave in ends and turn right side out.

materials: Bernat® Softee®BabyTM (5 oz/140 g; 362 yds/331 m)
Size U.S. 6 (4 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
1 ball makes approx 12 pairs of booties.
abbreviations: Dc3(5)tog = Double crochet the following 3(5) stitches together
measurements: To fit baby’s foot: 3/6 (12/18) mos.
gauge: 16 sc and 17 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
The instructions are written for smallest size. If changes are necessary for largest size, the instructions will be written thus ( ). Numbers for each size are shown in the same color throughout the pattern. When only one number is given in black it applies for both sizes.
Ch 16 (22).
1st row: (RS). 2 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 4 (7) ch. 2 sc in each of next 2 ch. 1 sc in next ch. 2 sc in each of next 2 ch. 1 sc in each of next 4 (7) ch. 2 sc in last ch. 21 (27) sc. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 7 (10) sc. 2 sc in each of next 2 sc. 1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in each of next 2 sc. 1 sc in each of next 7 (10) sc. 2 sc in last sc. 27 (33) sts. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 10 (13) sc. 2 sc in each of next 2 sc. 1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in each of next 2 sc. 1 sc in each of next 10 (13) sc. 2 sc in last sc. 33 (39) sts. Turn.
4th row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 13 (16) sc. 2 sc in each of next 2 sc. 1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in each of next 2 sc. 1 sc in each of next 13 (16) sc. 2 sc in last sc. 39 (43) sts. Turn.
5th row: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row 5 times more.
Shape Instep
1st row: (RS). Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each of next 13 (16) sc. [(Yoh and draw up a loop in next st. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 3 times. Yoh and draw through all 4 loops on hook – dc3tog made] twice. 1 dc in next sc. (Dc3tog over next 3 sts) twice. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
2nd row: (RS). Ch 1. Working in both loops, 1 sc in each of next 13 (16) sc. (Yoh and draw up a loop in next st. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 5 times. Yoh and draw through all 6 loops on hook – dc5tog made. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Fasten off.
Strap (make 2).
Ch 33 (40).
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. 32 (39) sc. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Ch 2. Miss next 2 sc. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc and 2 sc in ch-2 sps to end of row. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Sew back and sole seam. Sew Strap to Bootie as shown in picture. Sew buttons to correspond to buttonholes.

abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Boots should fit most babies 6-12 months. Foot Length: 4”.
gauge: 9 sts = 4” in sc. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the specified gauge.
instructions:
BOOT (make 2): Ch 8.
Round 1: Work 2 dc in 3rd ch from hook, dc in next 4 ch, 6 dc in last ch, turn to work along opposite side of beginning ch, dc in next 4 ch, 3 dc in last ch, slip st in top of beginning ch to join.
Round 2: Ch 1, sc in back loops only in each st around, slip st in beginning ch to join.
Round 3: Ch 1, sc in next 5 sts, [hdc2tog] 4 times, sc in next 6 sts, slip st in beginning ch to join.
Round 4: Ch 1, sc in next 5 sts, [hdc2tog] 2 times, sc in next 6 sts, slip st in beginning ch to join.
Rounds 5-7: Ch 1, sc in each st around, slip st in beginning ch to join.
Round 8: Ch 1, slip st in each st around, slip st to beginning ch to join. Fasten off.
FINISHING: Weave in ends.

materials: AUNT LYDIA’S® “Bamboo Crochet Thread” Size 3: 1 Ball each 0001 White A and 0012 Black B.
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
measurements: For size 6-12 months.
gauge: 23 sts = 4”; 16 rows = 4” in hdc. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge given.
instructions:
SOCK (Make 2)
With A, ch 18.
Row 1 (Right Side): Hdc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across; turn – 17 sts.
Row 2: Ch 2, hdc in blo of each st across; turn.
Repeat Row 2 until piece measures 1½”, ending with a Wrong Side row; do not turn on last row. Ch 13; turn.
Sock Top-Row 1: Hdc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch across, hdc in blo of last 17 hdc; turn – 29 sts.
Row 2: Ch 2, hdc in blo in 1st 17 sts, hdc through both loops to end; turn.
Row 3: Ch 2, hdc in 1st 12 sts, hdc in blo to end; turn.
Repeat Rows 2-3 until Sock Top measures 2” across, ending with Row 3.
Next Row: Ch 2, hdc in blo in 1st 17 sts; turn.
Repeat last row until Sock measures 5” across entire width, ending on a Right Side row.
Join Cuff: Fold cuff with Right Sides together, sc through outer loops of both sides. Do not fasten off.
Sock Edging: Ch 1, sc 11 evenly along bottom edge of Cuff, sc 12 along side of Sock Top (place marker in last st), sc 13 along front of Sock Top, sc 12 along side of Sock Top (place marker in first st), sc 12 along bottom edge of cuff; join to 1st sc. Fasten off.

SHOE (Make 2)
With B, ch 15.
Round 1: 2 Hdc in 2nd ch from hook, hdc in next 12 ch, 5 hdc in last ch; turn to work in unused loops of beginning ch, hdc in next 12 ch, 2 hdc in 1st ch; join – 33 sts.
Round 2: Ch 2, 2 hdc in same st as join, 2 hdc in next st, hdc in next 12 sts, [2 hdc in next st] 5 times; hdc in next 12 sts, [2 hdc in next st] 2 times; join – 42 sts.
Round 3: Ch 2, 2 hdc in same st as join, [2 hdc in next st] 2 times; hdc in next 16 sts, [2 hdc in next st] 6 times; hdc in next 16 sts, 2 hdc in next st, 2 hdc in same st as join; join – 54 sts.
Round 4: Ch 2, hdc in same st as join, hdc in next 25 sts, [2 hdc in next st] 6 times; hdc in next 22 sts; join – 60 sts.
Shoe Side-Round 5: Ch 2, hdc in blo in each st around; join.
Rounds 6-7: Ch 2, hdc in 1st 26 sts, place marker, dc in next 15 sts, place marker, hdc in next 19 sts; join.
Fasten off.

STRAP (Make 2)
With B, ch 21.
Row 1: Hdc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across.
Fasten off.

FINISHING
With Right Sides together, match markers of Sock and Shoe. With B, slip st through both loops of Sock and blo of Shoe in each st around. Fasten off. Turn Right Side out.
Join B in any unused loop of Shoe, ch 1, sc in same st and in each around; join to 1st st. Fasten off.
Attach Strap to sc edge of Shoe 1” from end of Sock. Tack down other side to other side of Shoe to mimic a Mary Jane shoe strap.
Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Baby TLC™: 1 ball 5942 Girlie Girl.
Two 9/16” (14 mm) size buttons, sewing needle and matching thread.
abbreviations: Single Crochet Decrease (sc2tog): (Insert hook into next st, yarn over, pull up a loop) twice, yarn over and draw through all 3 loops on hook.
measurements: Length of foot measures 4” (4½”).
gauge: 4 dc= 1”. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain gauge.
instructions:
RIGHT BOOTIE
Ch 11 (13).
Round 1: 3 sc in second ch from hook, sc in each of next 8 (10) chs, 3 sc in last ch; working on opposite side of beginning ch, sc in each of next 8 (10) chs, slip st into the first ch – 22 (26) sc.
Round 2: Ch 2 (count as hdc), hdc in same sp; 2 hdc in each of next 2 sc, dc in each of next 8 (10) sc, 2 hdc in each of next 3 sc, dc in each of next 8 (10) sc, slip st into the second ch – 28 (32) sts.
Round 3: Ch 2 (count as hdc), hdc in same sp; 2 hdc in each of next 5 hdc, dc in each of next 8 (10) dc, 2 hdc in each of next 6 hdc, dc in each of next 8 (10) dc, slip st into the second ch – 40 (44) sts.
Round 4: Ch 1, sc in the back loop of every st around; slip st into the first ch – 40 (44) sc.
Rounds 5-6: Ch 1, sc in every sc around; do not join.
Round 7: Sc in each of next 18 (20) sts; sc2tog in next 14 sts, sc in each of next 8 (10) sc – 33 (37) sc.
Round 8: Sc in each of next 18 (20) sc; sc2tog in next 8 sts, sc in each of next 7 (9) sc – 29 (33) sc.
Fasten off.
T-strap
Join yarn to the center front st; ch 5.
Row 1: Sc in second ch from hook, sc in each of next 3 chs; slip st into the same st as the attachment.
Fasten off.
Strap
Row 1: Starting from the T-strap, skip next 5 (7) sts; join yarn to the next st, sc in next 18 (20) sts, ch 5, sc in the side of each of next 2 sts at the top of the T-strap, ch 10; turn.
Row 2: Skip next 5 ch for button loop, sc in next 32 (36) sts.
Fasten off.
LEFT BOOTIE
Work same as Right Bootie. Work strap as follows:
Row 1: Starting from the T-strap and working in opposite direction of Right Bootie Strap, skip next 5 (7) sts; join yarn to the next st, sc in next 18 (20) sts, ch 5, sc in the side of each of next 2 sts at the top of the T-strap, ch 10; turn.
Row 2: Skip next 5 ch for button loop, sc in next 32 (36) sts. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Sew button at the edge of ankle of the bootie. Weave in all ends. 
These cute booties are perfect for the baby. With a T-strap and a cute button, nothing is better for your lovely new baby.

materials: 1 ball each 941 Scooter A, and 100 Lily B
abbreviations: A and B = Color A, Color B
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Finished Length: 3 (3¾)” (7.5 (9.5) cm)
gauge: 16 sts = 4” (10 cm); 21 rows = 4” (10 cm) in single crochet using larger hook. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
BOOTIES (make 2)
Sole
With larger hook and A, ch 7 (9).  
Foundation Row: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across—6 (8) sc.  
Next 6 (7) Rows: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st across.
Next Row: Ch 1, turn, 2 sc in first sc, sc in each sc across to last sc, 2 sc in last sc—8 (10) sc.
Next 7 (10) Rows: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st across.
Sides
Round 1: Do not turn, work 14 (18) sc evenly spaced down side of sole; work 6 (8) sc across opposite side of foundation ch (this is the heel); work 14 (18) sc evenly spaced up other side of sole; sc in each st of last row; do not join, work in continuous rounds (spiral)—42 (54) sc. Place marker in last stitch made to indicate end of round. Move marker up as work progresses.  
Next 3 (4) Rounds: Working in front loops only, sc in each sc around.
Top of Foot
Notes: The top of foot is worked back and forth in rows across one end of the bootie. Take care to turn when instructed. When working the top of foot, do not ch 1 at beginning of rows.  
Row 1: Sc in next 1 (2) sc, slip st in next sc, TURN and leave remaining sts unworked; skip slip st, working in front loops only, sc in next 8 (10) sc; working in both loops, slip st in next 2 sc, TURN; leave remaining sts unworked.
Next 8 (12) Rows: Skip first 2 slip sts, working in front loops only, sc in next 8 (10) sc across top of foot; working in both loops, slip st in next 2 unworked sc on side of Bootie, turn.
Cuff
Rounds 1 and 2: Sc in each st all the way around top of Bootie, working twice around and ending at center back of Bootie. Fasten off.
Ribbing
With right side facing and smaller hook draw up a loop of B in last st of cuff (at center back).
Round 1 (right side): Ch 3 (counts as first dc here and throughout), work 24 (28) more dc evenly spaced around top of cuff; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—25 (29) dc.
Round 2: Ch 3, *Fpdc around next st, Bpdc around next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch.
Repeat Round 2 for a total of 10 rounds of ribbing or until cuff is desired length.
Last Round: Change to larger hook, repeat Round 2. Fasten off.
FINISHING BOOTIES
Weave in ends. Turn down cuff.

abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Boots should fit most babies 6-12 months. Foot Length: 4”.
gauge: 14 sts = 4” in hdc. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
BOOT (make 2)
Ch 9.
Round 1: Work 2 dc in 3rd ch from hook, dc in next 5 ch, 6 dc in last ch, turn to work along opposite side of beginning ch, dc in next 5 ch, 3 dc in last ch, slip st in top of beginning ch to join.  - 22 sts
Round 2: Ch 2, hdc in same st as slip st, 2 hdc in each of next 2 dc, hdc in next 5 dc, 2 hdc in each of next 6 dc, hdc in next 5 dc, 2 hdc in each of next 3 dc, slip st in top of beginning ch to join.  - 34 sts
Round 3: Ch 2, hdc through back loop in each st around, slip st to top of beginning ch to join. - 34 sts
Round 4: Ch 2, hdc in next 8 sts, [dc2tog] 8 times, hdc in next 9 sts, slip st to top of beginning ch to join. - 26 sts
Round 5: Ch 2, hdc in next 8 sts, [dc2tog] 4 times, hdc in next 9 sts, slip st to top of beginning ch to join. - 22 sts
Round 6: Ch 2, hdc in next 8 sts, [dc2tog] 2 times, hdc in next 9 sts, slip st to top of beginning ch to join. - 20 sts
Round 7: Ch 2, dc in each st around, slip st to top of beginning ch to join. - 20 sts
Round 8: Ch 2, hdc in each st around, slip st to top of beginning ch to join. - 20 sts
Round 9: Ch 1, sc in each st around, slip st to top of beginning ch to join. - 20 sts
Round 10: Slip st in each st around. - 20 sts
Fasten off.
FINISHING
TIE (make 2)
Ch 80.
Fasten off. Weave in ends back into chain.
Beginning and ending at center of Front, weave one Tie in and out at Round 7 on each Boot.

materials: RED HEART® Buttercup™: 1 ball 4273 Light Multi Yellow.
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Booties fit most babies 6-12 months. Foot Length: 4”.
gauge: 9 sts = 4” in sc. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the specified gauge.
instructions:
BOOTIES (make 2)
Ch 8.
Round 1: Work 2 dc in 3rd ch from hook, (beginning ch counts as first dc) dc in next 4 ch, 6 dc in last ch, turn to work along opposite side of beginning ch, dc in next 4 ch, 3 dc in last ch, slip st in top of beginning ch to join—20 dc.
Round 2: Ch 1, sc in back loops only in each st around, slip st in beginning ch to join.
Round 3: Ch 1, sc in next 6 sts, [hdc2tog] 4 times, sc in next 6 sts, slip st in beginning ch to join¬—16sts.
Round 4: Ch 1, sc in next 6 sts, [hdc2tog] 2 times, sc in next 6 sts, slip st in beginning ch to join—14sts.
Rounds 5-7: Ch 1, sc in each st around, slip st in beginning ch to join.
Round 8: Ch 1, slip st in each st around, slip st to beginning ch to join.
Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.

materials: Aunt Lydia’s® Baby Shower™ (170 yds/155 m)
Size U.S. D/3 (3.25 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
2 snap closures for each pair of booties.
abbreviations: Hdc2tog = (Yoh and draw up a loop in next st) twice. Yoh and draw through all 5 loops on hook
measurements: To fit infant 0-3 mos. Sole: Approx 3¼" [8.5 cm].
gauge: 22 sc and 24 rows = 4" [10 cm]
instructions:
Notes:
• Each bootie is worked from sole upwards.
• Sole and sides of bootie are worked in joined rnds.
• Top of foot is worked back and forth in rows over toe end of bootie.
• Ch 2 at beg of rnd does not count as st.
• To change color, work to last 2 loops on hook and draw new color through last 2 loops, then proceed in new color.

BOOTIE (make 2)
Sole
With A, ch 16.
1st rnd: 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each ch to last ch. 3 hdc in last ch. Do not turn. Working in rem loops of foundation ch, 1 hdc in each of next 11 ch. 1 hdc in next ch (same sp as first hdc). Join with sl st to top of first hdc. 28 hdc.

2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in same sp as sl st. 2 sc in next hdc. 1 sc in each of next 6 hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. 2 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. 1 sc in each of next 6 hdc. 2 sc in last st. Join with sl st in first sc. 34 sts.

3rd rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in same sp as sl st. 2 hdc in each of next 3 sts. 1 hdc in each of next 5 sts. 1 dc in each of next 7 sts. 2 dc in each of next 5 sts. 1 dc in each of next 7 sts. 1 hdc in each of next 5 sts. 2 hdc in last st. Join with sl st to top of first hdc. 44 sts. Fasten off.

Note: Wider end of sole is for toe and narrower end of sole is for heel.

Side
1st rnd: Join B with sl st to back loop of first st. Ch 1. Form welt st as follows: Insert hook in back loop of same sp as sl st then through horizontal loop on WS ¼-½" [6-13 mm] directly below. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice. *Welt St in next st. Rep from * around. Join with sl st first st. 44 sts.

2nd rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each st around. Join with sl st in top of first hdc. PM on stitch at center of toe.

3rd rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each st to 2 sts before marked st. 2 hdc in each of next 2 sts. 1 hdc in marked st. Remove marker. 2 hdc in each of next 2 sts. 1 hdc in each st to end of rnd. Join with sl st to top of first hdc. 48 sts.

4th rnd: Ch 2. (Hdc2tog) twice. 1 hdc in each of next 12 sts. 1 sc in each of next 20 sts. 1 hdc in each of next 12 sts. Join with sl st to first hdc. 46 sts. Fasten off.

Top of Foot
Notes:
Version 1: Work top of foot with C.
Version 2: Work top of foot with B.
With RS facing, join yarn with sl st in last hdc before 20 sc at toe end of Bootie.

1st row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 hdc in same sp as sl st. 1 hdc in next st. (Hdc2tog) 4 times. 1 hdc in next st. (Hdc2tog) 4 times. 1 hdc in each of next 2 sts. 1 sc in next st. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. 14 sts.

Beg working in rnd: 
Next rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 3 sts. (Hdc2tog) twice. 1 hdc in next st. (Hdc2tog) twice. 1 hdc in each of next 2 sts. Cont working across heel section: Sl st in next st. 1 sc in each st to end of rnd. Join with sl st in top of first hdc. Fasten off.

Slip Stitch Trim
Version 1: With RS facing, join C with sl st in top edge of bootie where Top of Foot meets Side (so that you are ready to work towards the heel). Sl st in each st along heel, ending at Top of Foot. Join B. With B, sl st in each st along edge of Top of Foot to end of rnd. Fasten off.

Version 2: With RS facing, join A with sl st at edge of Bootie. Sl st in each st around top edge of Bootie. Fasten off.

STRAP (make 1 for each Bootie)
With B, ch 18, leaving long end of yarn for sewing to Bootie.
1st row: (RS). 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook and each ch to end of chain. Turn. 16 hdc. Fasten off.

Refer to photograph as a guide to placement and using long end of yarn, sew end of Strap to Bootie.
Note: The attached yarn tail is at different ends of each of the two straps. One strap is sewn on right edge of one bootie and the other strap is sewn on left edge of the second bootie, creating a left and a right bootie.

FINISHING
Sew top of a snap closure to underside of free end of each strap. Sew decorative button to topside of same end of strap. Sew bottom of snap closure to side of bootie, opposite top of snap at end of strap. Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Baby Clouds™: 1 skein 9549 Orchid.
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Booties fit most babies 6-12 months. Foot Length: 4”.
gauge: 9 sts = 4” in sc. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the specified gauge.
instructions:
BOOTIES (make 2)
Ch 8.
Round 1: Work 2 dc in 3rd ch from hook, (beginning ch counts as first dc) dc in next 4 ch, 6 dc in last ch, turn to work along opposite side of beginning ch, dc in next 4 ch, 3 dc in last ch, slip st in top of beginning ch to join—20 dc.
Round 2: Ch 1, sc in back loops only in each st around, slip st in beginning ch to join.
Round 3: Ch 1, sc in next 6 sts, [hdc2tog] 4 times, sc in next 6 sts, slip st in beginning ch to join¬—16 sts.
Round 4: Ch 1, sc in next 6 sts, [hdc2tog] 2 times, sc in next 6 sts, slip st in beginning ch to join—14 sts.
Rounds 5-7: Ch 1, sc in each st around, slip st in beginning ch to join.
Round 8: Ch 1, slip st in each st around, slip st to beginning ch to join.
Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.

materials: Patons® Beehive Baby Sport™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 359 yds/328 m)
Size U.S. C/2 (2.75 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sc. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook.
measurements: To fit baby’s feet 6 (12) mos.
gauge: 22 dc and 13 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
The instructions are written for smaller size. If changes are necessary for larger sizes the instructions will be written thus ( ). When only one number is given, it applies to both sizes. For ease in working, circle all numbers pertaining to your size.
Notes:
• Ch 3 at beg of rnd counts as dc throughout.
• Join rnds with sl st to top of ch 3 or first sc.
Motif (make 2)
Ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form a ring.
1st rnd: Ch 3. 2 dc in ring. (Ch 2. 3 dc) 3 times in ring. Ch 2. Join.
2nd rnd: Sl st in each of next 2 dc and ch-2 sp. Ch 3. (2 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in same sp as last sl st. [Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in next ch-2 sp] 3 times. Ch 1. Join.
3rd rnd: Sl st in each of next 2 dc and ch-2 sp. Ch 3. (2 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in same sp. [Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in next ch-2 sp] 3 times. Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Join. Fasten off.
Foot: 1st rnd: (RS). Join yarn with sl st to any corner ch-2 sp of Motif. Ch 1. 2 sc in same sp as last sl st. (Work 7 sc along side of Motif. 3 sc in next ch-2 sp) twice. Work 7 sc along side of Motif. 2 sc in next ch-2 sp. Ch 27 (31) loosely. Join. Place marker on last sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 31 sc. 1 dc in each of next 27 (31) ch. Join. 58 (62) dc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each dc around. Join.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
Rep last rnd 2 (3) times more.
Shape Sole: 1st rnd: Ch 1. Working through back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 7 (8) sc. (Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc) twice. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 17 (19) sc. Sc2tog. (1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc2tog) twice. 1 sc in each of next 10 (11) sc. Join. 52 (56) sts.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 5 (6) sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 15 (17) sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 7 sts. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 10 (11) sc. Join. 48 (52) sts.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 5 (6) sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 15 (17) sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 10 (11) sc. Join. 44 (48) sts.
5th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 5 (6) sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 15 (17)sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 10 (11) sc. Join. 40 (44) sts.
6th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 5 (6) sc. (Sc2tog) 3 times. 1 sc in each of next 15 (17) sc. (Sc2tog) 3 times. 1 sc in each of next 8 (9) sc. Join. 34 (38) sts. Fasten off. Sew bottom of sole.
Ankle: With RS facing, join yarn with sl st to right corner ch-2 sp of Motif. 1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. Work 7 sc evenly across side of Motif. 1 sc in next ch-2 sp. Working in rem loops of ch, 1 sc in each of next 27 (31) ch. Join. 36 (40) sc.
2nd rnd: (Eyelet row). Ch 3. 1 dc in next sc. *Ch 2. Skip next 2 sc. 1 dc in each of next 1 (2) sc. Rep from * around, omitting last 1 (2) dc. Join.
3rd rnd: Ch 3. *1 dc in next 1 (2) dc. 2 dc in next ch-2 sp. Rep from * around. Join.
4th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in each dc around. Join.
5th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each dc around. Join.
6th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Ch 3. Sl st in 3rd ch from hook - picot made. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join. Fasten off.
Drawstring: Ch 80. Beg with 2nd ch from hook, sl st into each “bump” along back of ch. Fasten off. Weave drawstring through eyelet row at ankle.

pattern_name: Flat Booties with Slip Stitch Trim
materials: Aunt Lydia’s® Baby Shower™ (170 yds/155 m)
Size U.S. D/3 (3.25 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: To fit infant 0-3 mos. Sole: Approx 3¼" [8.5 cm].
gauge: 22 sc and 24 rows = 4" [10 cm]
instructions:
Notes:
• Each bootie is made from a flat piece that is folded and seamed to form bootie.
• Surface slip stitch trim is worked around top opening of each bootie. 
BOOTIE (make 2)
With A, ch 19, leaving long end of yarn for sewing.
First Side
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch to end of chain. 18 sc. Turn.
2nd to 18th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. Do not fasten off at end of last row.
Toe
1st row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 9 sc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. 9 sc.
2nd to 9th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 9 sc. Turn. Do not fasten off at end of last row.

Second Side
1st row: Ch 10. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and each of next 8 ch. 1 sc in each of next 9 sc. 18 sc.
2nd to 18th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. Fasten off, leaving 18-20" [45.5-51 cm] end of yarn for sewing.
FINISHING
Fold Bootie in half. With beginning tail, sew heel seam. With ending tail, sew sole seam. Continue with ending tail, weave tail through ends of rows at toe and pull tightly to form toe and close opening. Weave in ends.
Surface Slip Stitch Trim
With B, work surface slip stitch trim around top opening of each bootie, as follows:
With RS facing, beg at heel end of bootie, hold yarn on WS. Leaving a long beg end of yarn, insert hook from RS to WS in top edge of bootie. Yoh and draw loop through fabric to RS (1 loop on hook). 
*Insert hook in next stitch along top edge of bootie. Yoh and draw loop through fabric and through loop on hook. Rep from * around top edge of bootie. Fasten off.
Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® “Buttercup™”: 1 ball 4274 Petal Pink Multi OR 4272 White Coral Multi
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Boots should fit most babies 6-12 months. Foot Length: 4”.
gauge: 9 sts = 4” in sc. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the specified gauge.
instructions:
BOOTIE (make 2)
Ch 8.
Round 1: Work 2 dc in 3rd ch from hook, dc in next 4 ch, 6 dc in last ch, turn to work along opposite side of beginning ch, dc in next 4 ch, 3 dc in last ch, slip st in top of beginning ch to join.
Round 2: Ch 1, sc in back loops only in each st around, slip st in beginning ch to join.
Round 3: Ch 1, sc in next 5 sts, [hdc2tog] 4 times, sc in next 6 sts, slip st in beginning ch to join.
Round 4: Ch 1, sc in next 5 sts, [hdc2tog] 2 times, sc in next 6 sts, slip st in beginning ch to join.
Rounds 5-7: Ch 1, sc in each st around, slip st in beginning ch to join.
Round 8: Ch 1, slip st in each st around, slip st to beginning ch to join.
Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.

materials: Bernat® Handicrafter Cotton (50 g / 1.75 oz/73 m/80 yds) or Bernat® Satin (100 g / 3.5 oz/149 m/163 yds)
Size 4 mm (U.S. G or 6) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: To fit infant 3 (6-12) mos.
gauge: 14 sc and 15 rows = 4 ins [10 cm].
instructions:
The instructions are written for smallest size. If changes are necessary for larger sizes the instructions will be written thus (  ). 
Cuff: Ch 16.
1st row:1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 15 sc.
2nd row:Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc across.
Rep last row until work from beg measures 6 (6¼-6½) ins [15 (16-16.5) cm], ending with a RS row. Do not turn.
Foot: 1st row: (RS). Ch 1. Work 23 (25-27) sc evenly along long edge of Cuff. Turn.
2nd row:Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc across.
Fasten off.
Instep: 1st row: With RS of work facing, miss first 7 (8-9) sc. Join yarn with sl st to next sc. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. 9 sc.
2nd to 4th rows:Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc across. Turn.
5th row: Ch 1. Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sts. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook– sc2tog made. 1 sc in each of next 5 sts. Sc2tog over next 2 sts. 7 sts. Fasten off.
Sew back seam.
Foot: 1st rnd: With RS of work facing, join yarn with sl st at center back. Ch 2 (counts as hdc). 1 hdc in each of next 6 (7-8) sts, 7 hdc down side of instep, 2 hdc in corner sc, 5 hdc across end of instep, 2 hdc in corner sc, 7 hdc along other side of instep, 1 hdc in each of next 7 (8-9) sts. Join with sl st in top of ch 2. 37 (39-41) hdc.
2nd rnd: Ch 2 (counts as hdc). * Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next st at back of work inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice– 1 dcbp made. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch 2.
3rd rnd: As 2nd rnd.
4th rnd: Ch 1. Sc2tog over first 2 sts. 1 sc in each of next 14 (15-16) sts. Sc2tog over next 2 sts. 1 sc in next st. Sc2tog over next 2 sts. 1 sc in each of next 14 (15-16) sts. Sc2tog over last 2 sts. Join with sl st to first st. 33 (35-37) sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. Sc2tog over first 2 sts. 1 sc in each of next 12 (13-14) sc. Sc2tog over next 2 sts. 1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog over next 2 sts. 1 sc in each of next 12 (13-14) sc. Sc2tog over last 2 sts. Join with sl st to first st. 29 (31-33) sts.
6th rnd: Ch 1. Sc2tog over first 2 sts. 1 sc in each of next 10 (11-12) sc. Sc2tog over next 2 sts. 1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog over next 2 sts. 1 sc in each of next 10 (11-12) sc. Sc2tog over last 2 sts. Join with sl st to first st. 25 (27-29) sts.
7th rnd: Ch 1. Sc2tog over first 2 sts. 1 sc in each of next 8 (9-10) sc. Sc2tog over next 2 sts. 1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog over next 2 sts. 1 sc in each of next 8 (9-10) sc. Sc2tog over last 2 sts. Join with sl st to first st. 21 (23-25) sts.
Fasten off.
Sew sole seam.

materials: RED HEART® With Love®: 1 skein 1308 Tan
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Boots fit most babies 6-12 months. Foot Length: 4” (10 cm).
gauge: 14 sts = 4” (10 cm) in hdc. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
BOOT (make 2)
Ch 9.
Round 1: Work 2 dc in 3rd ch from hook, ddc in next 5 ch, 6 dc in last ch, turn to work along opposite side of beginning ch, dc in next 5 ch, 3 dc in last ch, slip st in top of beginning ch to join. – 22sts
Round 2: Ch 2, hdc in same st as slip st, 2 hdc in each of next 2 dc, hdc in next 5 dc, 2 hdc in each of next 6 dc, hdc in next 5 dc, 2 hdc in each of next 3 dc, slip st in top of beginning ch to join. – 34sts.
Round 3: Ch 2, hdc through back loop in each st around, slip st to top of beginning ch to join. – 34sts
Round 4: Ch 2, hdc in next 8 sts, [dc2tog] 8 times, hdc in next 9 sts, slip st to top of beginning ch to join. – 26sts
Round 5: Ch 2, hdc in next 8 sts, [dc2tog] 4 times, hdc in next 9 sts, slip st to top of beginning ch to join. – 22sts
Round 6: Ch 2, hdc in next 8 sts, [dc2tog] 2 times, hdc in next 9 sts, slip st to top of beginning ch to join. – 20sts
Round 7: Ch 2, dc in each st around, slip st to top of beginning ch to join.  – 20sts
Round 8: Ch 2, hdc in each st around, slip st to top of beginning ch to join. – 20sts
Round 9: Ch 1, sc in each st around, slip st to top of beginning ch to join. – 20sts
Round 10: Slip st in each st around.
Fasten off. – 20sts
FINISHING
Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Baby Hugs™ Light: 1 ball each of any two of the following: 3830 Pool, 3724 Pinkie, 3001 Frosting
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
measurements: Finished Sole Length: 4 (4½, 5)” [10 (11.5, 12.5) cm]
gauge: 7 sts = 2” [5 cm]; 4 rounds = 2” [5 cm] in half double crochet (hdc). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
BOOTIE (make 2)
With first color, ch 9 (11, 13).
Round 1 (right side): Work 2 hdc in 2nd ch from hook, hdc in next 6 (8, 10) ch, 6 hdc in last ch; working across opposite side of foundation ch, hdc in next 6 (8, 10) ch, 2 hdc in next ch; join with slip st in first hdc—22 (26, 30) hdc.
Round 2: Ch 1, 2 hdc in first st, hdc in next 7 (9, 11) sts, 2 hdc in next 6 sts, hdc in next 7 (9, 11) sts, 2 hdc in last st; join with slip st in first hdc—30 (34, 38) hdc. 
Round 3: Ch 1, sc in each st around; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off.
Round 4: With right side facing, join second color with slip st in same st as joining, repeat Round 3.
Round 5: Ch 1, sc in first 9 (11, 13) sc, [hdc2tog] 6 times, sc in last 9 (11, 13) sc; join with slip st in first sc—24 (28, 32) sts.
Round 6: Ch 1, sc in first 8 (10, 12) sts, [hdc2tog] 4 times, sc in next 8 (10, 12) sts; join with slip st in first sc—20 (24, 28) sts. 
Fasten off.
FINISHING
Set two booties side by side. Place a marker at center of inside edge of each bootie.
Strap and Trim: Join first color with slip st in marked st, ch 18 (20, 22) for strap, sc in same st and each st around; join with slip st in first slip st. Fasten off.
Sew a button to top edge of each bootie, opposite strap. Weave in ends.

materials: 1 ball each 2205 Little Lamb A and 2012 Black Sheep B
abbreviations: Dec (decrease) = draw up a loop in next 2 sts, yarn over and draw through all 3 loops on hook
measurements: Bootie measures 4½” long x 2” at widest part. Directions are for size 9-12 months.
gauge: 20 sts = 4” in sc rounds. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Sole
With larger hook and A, ch 13.
Round 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next 10 ch, 3 sc in last ch, sc in 10 ch on opposite side of beginning ch, 3 sc in last ch; join with a slip st in first sc – 27 sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, inc in same sc as joining, * sc in next 10 sc, [inc] 3 times; repeat from * once more; join – 34 sc.
Round 3: Ch 1, inc in same sc as joining, inc in next sc, sc in next 9 sc, hdc in next 2 sc, [inc] 5 times, hdc in next 2 sc, sc in next 9 sc, [inc] twice, sc in next 3 sc; join – 43 sts.
Round 4: Ch 1, inc in same sc as joining, [inc] twice, sc in next 11 sts, hdc in next 3 sts, [2 hdc in next st, hdc in next 3 sts] twice, sc in next 13 sts, [inc] twice, sc in next 3 sts; join – 50 sts.
Round 5: Ch 2, working in back loops only hdc in each st around; join in top of ch-2. Fasten off.
Bootie Upper
Round 1: Attach B in same st as joining; ch 1, working in back loops only, sc in each st around; join.
Rounds 2 and 3: Ch 1, sc in each sc around; join. Fasten off.
Ankle
Row 1: Skip next 33 sc of last round, join B in next sc; ch 1, sc in same sc, hdc in next 28 sc, sc in next sc; turn – 30 sts.
Row 2: Ch 1, dec, sc in next 7 sts, [dec] twice, sc in next 4 sts, [dec] twice, sc in next 7 sts, dec – 24 sts. Fasten off.
Toe Piece
Round 1: With larger hook and B, ch 2; 6 sc in 2nd ch from; join in first sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, [inc] 6 times; join – 12 sc.
Round 3: Ch 1, [inc, sc in next sc] 6 times; join – 18 sc.
Round 4: Ch 1, [inc, sc in next 2 sc] 6 times; join – 24 sc.
Row 5: Ch 1, sc in next 8 sc; TURN.
Row 6: Ch 2, hdc in first 7 sc, 2 hdc in last sc – 11 sts. Fasten off leaving long tail for sewing.
Finishing
Weave in ends. Sew ends of Rows 5 and 6 of Toe to ends of Rows 1 and 2 of Ankle; ease remaining sts of Toe to Bootie Upper. Embroider eye sockets onto skull head with A. Sew finished skull to upper portion of the toe area. Embroider crossbones by making 2 long running stitches. Tack stitches together at intersection with yarn. Add French Knots at each bone end.

materials: Aunt Lydia’s® Baby Shower™ (170 yds/155 m)
Size U.S. D/3 (3.25 mm) Susan Bates® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
2 decorative buttons for each pair of loafers.
abbreviations: Hdc2tog = (Yoh and draw up a loop in next st) twice. Yoh and draw through all 5 loops on hook
Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sc. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook
measurements: To fit infant 0-3 mos. Sole: Approx 3¼" [8.5 cm].
gauge: 22 sc and 24 rows = 4" [10 cm]
instructions:
Notes:
• Each loafer is worked from the sole upwards.
• Sole and sides of loafer are worked in joined rounds. 
• Toe inset is worked separately, back and forth in rows.
• Inset is crocheted to body of loafer.
• Ch 2 at beg of row does not count as st
• Join all rnds with sl st to first stitch.
• To change color, work to last 2 loops on hook and draw new color through last 2 loops, then proceed in new color.

LOAFER (make 2)
Sole
With A, ch 16.
1st rnd: 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each ch to last ch. 3 hdc in last ch. Do not turn. Working in rem loops of foundation chain, 1 hdc in each of next 11 ch. 1 hdc next ch (same ch as first hdc). Join with sl st to top of first hdc. 28 hdc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in same sp as sl st. 2 sc in next st. 1 sc in each of next 6 sts. 1 hdc in each of next 5 sts. 2 hdc in each of next 3 sts. 1 hdc in each of next 5 sts. 1 sc in each of next 6 sts. 2 sc in last st. Join with sl st in first sc. 34 sts.
3rd rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in same sp as sl st. 2 hdc in each of next 3 sts. 1 hdc in each of next 5 sts. 1 dc in each of next 7 sts. 2 dc in each of next 5 sts. 1 dc in each of next 7 sts. 1 hdc in each of next 5 sts. 2 hdc in last st. Join with sl st to top of first hdc. 44 sts. Fasten off. 
Note: Wider end of sole is for toe and narrower end of sole is for heel.

Sides
1st rnd: Join B with sl st to back loop of first st. Ch 1. Form welt st as follows: Insert hook in back loop of same sp as sl st then through horizontal loop on WS ¼-½" [6-13 mm] directly below. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice. *Welt st in next st. Rep from * around. Join with sl st first st. 44 sts.
PM in first and last of the 22 sts at center of toe end of loafer. 

2nd rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each st to first marker. 1 sc in each of next 7 sts. (Sc2tog) 4 times. 1 sc in each of next 7 sts. 1 hdc in each st to end of rnd. Join with sl st to top of first hdc. 40 sts. Fasten off.

TOE INSET
With A, ch 10.
1st row: 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in ch to end of chain. 8 hdc. Turn. 
2nd row: Ch 1. Sl st in each hdc to end of row. Turn. 
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sl st to end of row. Turn. 
4th row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first st. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. 2 sc in last st. Turn. 10 sc.
5th and 6th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
7th to 9th rows: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 4 sts at end of last row.
Fasten off.

Attach Toe Inset
Note: 2nd row (slip st row) of Inset looks like “dashes” when RS is facing you.
Hold toe inset with RS facing up, with the 4 sts of the last row of inset matching the 4 decs at toe end of loafer. Align ends of 2nd row (slip st row) of inset with first and last sc of last rnd of loafer. Working through both thicknesses and beg in row below instep 2nd row, Yoh and draw A through both sts, leaving a long yarn tail to weave in later, *insert hook through end of next row of inset and then through next st of loafer, Yoh and draw through both sts and through loop on hook. Rep from * around edge of toe to just below other end of 2nd row of toe inset. Fasten off.

Trim and Strengthen Opening
PM on each side of 6 sts centered over heel end of loafer. 
1st row: With RS facing, join B with sl st in same st of loafer as last st of toe inset joining so that you are ready to work towards heel. 1 hdc in each st to first heel marker. (Hdc2tog) 3 times. 1 hdc in each st to toe inset. Sl st in same sp as last st of toe inset joining. Turn. 
2nd row: Working from inside the loafer, sl st firmly in each hdc to give upper edge of opening some strength. Fasten off.

BAND (make 2)
Note: Leave long tail at beg and end of strap for sewing band to loafer.
With B, ch 11.
1st row: (RS). 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook and in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 9 hdc.
2nd row: Ch 1. Sl st in each hdc to end of row.
Fasten off.

FINISHING
With RS of band facing up, place one band on toe inset of each loafer. Arrange slip stitch row of band at top and place it just below slip stitch row of inset. With long tails still attached to band, using photograph as a guide to placement, sew band to loafer. Sew a decorative button to one end of each band.
Weave in ends.

materials: Bernat® Baby Blanket Tiny™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 316 yds/288 m)
Seedling (14008) or Dungarees (14010) or Red Barn (14006) 1 ball
Size U.S. G/6 (4 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Dc4tog = (Yoh and draw up a loop in next stitch. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 4 times. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
measurements: To fit baby foot sizes 6-12 (18-24) months.
gauge: 15 sc and 16 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
The instructions are written for smaller size. If changes are necessary for larger size the instructions will be written thus ( ). Numbers for each size are shown in the same color throughout the pattern. When only one number is given in black, it applies to both sizes.
Note: Ch 2 at beg of rnds does not count as a st.
Ch 8 (10). 
1st rnd: 2 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 3 (5) ch. 1 hdc in next ch. 2 dc in next ch. 6 dc in last ch. Working into rem loops along opposite side of ch, 2 dc in next ch. 1 hdc in next ch. 1 sc in each of next 3 (5) ch. 2 sc in last ch. Join with sl st to first sc. 22 (26) sts.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 3 hdc in first sc. 1 hdc in each of next 7 (9) sts. 2 hdc in next dc. 1 hdc in next dc. 3 hdc in each of next 2 dc. 1 hdc in next dc. 2 hdc in next dc. 1 hdc in each of next 7 (9) sts. 3 hdc in last st. Join with sl st to first hdc. 32 (36) sts.
3rd rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in each of first 2 sts. 1 hdc in each of next 9 (11) hdc. (2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in next hdc) twice. 2 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. (1 hdc in next hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc) twice. 1 hdc in each of next 9 (11) hdc. 2 hdc in each of last 2 hdc. Join with sl st to first hdc. 42 (46) sts.
4th rnd: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc.
5th to 7th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
8th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 11 (13) sc. (1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog) 6 times. 1 sc in each of next 12 (14) sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 36 (40) sts.
9th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 11 (13) sc. (1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog) 4 times. 1 sc in each of next 12 (14) sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 32 (36) sts.
10th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 11 (13) sc. (Sc2tog) 4 times. 1 sc in each of next 12 (14) sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 28 (32) sts.
11th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 11 (13) sc. Dc4tog. 1 sc in each of next 12 (14) sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 25 (29) sts.
12th to 17th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
18th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 (3) sc. Ch 6. Skip next 6 sts. 1 sc in each of next 7 (9) sc. Ch 6. Skip next 6 sts. 1 sc in each of next 3 (4) sc. Join with sl st to first sc.
19th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 (3) sc. 6 sc in next ch-6 sp. 1 sc in each of next 7 (9) sc. 6 sc in next ch-6 sp. 1 sc in each of next 3 (4) sc. Join with sl st to first sc.
20th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Fasten off.

materials: 24” (61 cm) of ¼” (6 mm) wide pink organdy ribbon
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Booties measure 4” long (10 cm)
instructions:
Large Rose (make 2)
With smaller hook and B, leaving a 12” (30.5 cm) tail and with smaller hook, ch 11.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook, sc in each ch across, turn—10 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, 3 sc in each st across—30 sc.
Fasten off.

Small Rose (make 2)
With smaller hook and B, leaving a 12” (30.5 cm) tail and with smaller hook, ch 7.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook, sc in each ch across, turn—6 sc. 
Row 2: Ch 1, 3 sc in each st across—18 sc. 
Fasten off.

Roll up flowers, using yarn needle and sewing length, sew along bottom edge to hold in place. Sew onto bootie using photo for a guide.

FINISHING
Weave in ends. Using a 12” (30.5 cm) of ribbon, fold over to make a bow. With sewing needle and thread, sew onto bootie, using photo as a guide. Sew on 3 beads to center of bow.

Special Abbreviations 
hdc2tog: [Yarn over, insert hook in next st, draw up a loop] twice, yarn over, draw yarn through all loops on hook.
dc2tog: [Yarn over, insert hook in next st, draw up a loop, yarn over and draw through 2 loops on hook] twice, yarn over, draw yarn through 3 loops on hook. 

Bootie (make 2)
With larger hook and A, ch 9.
Round 1: 2 hdc in 3rd ch from hook, hdc in next 5 ch, 6 hdc in last ch, turn to work across opposite side of foundation ch, hdc in next 5 ch, 3 hdc in last ch; join with a slip st in top of beginning ch-2—22 sts.
Round 2: Ch 3 (counts as dc), dc in first st, 2 dc in each of next 2 sts, dc in next 5 sts, 2 dc in each of next 6 sts, dc in next 5 sts, 2 dc in each of next 3 sts; join with a slip st in top of beginning ch-3—34 sts.
Round 3: Ch 2 (counts as hdc here and throughout), hdc in back loop of each st around; join with a slip st in top of beginning ch-2—34 sts.
Round 4: Ch 2, hdc in next 8 sts, [hdc2tog over next 2 sts] 8 times, hdc in next 9 sts; join with a slip st in top of beginning ch-2—26 sts.
Round 5: Ch 2, hdc in next 8 sts, [dc2tog over next 2 sts] 4 times, hdc in next 9 sts; join with a slip st in top of beginning ch-2—22 sts.
Round 6: Ch 2, hdc in next 8 sts, [dc2tog over next 2 sts] twice, hdc in next 9 sts; join with a slip st in top of beginning ch-2—20 sts. 
Fasten off.

materials: Aunt Lydia’s® Baby Shower ™ (170 yds/155 m) Lavender Bliss (3620) 1 ball
Size U.S. D/3 (3.25 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Hdc-slip (half double crochet slip stitch) = Yoh and draw up a loop in indicated st and through all loops on hook
measurements: To fit infant 0-3 mos. Sole: Approx 3¼" [8.5 cm].
gauge: 22 sc and 24 rows = 4" [10 cm]
instructions:
Notes:
• Each bootie is made from a flat piece that is folded and seamed to form bootie.
• The toe inset of the piece is worked in hdc-slip (half double crochet slip stitch). Take care not to work the hdc-slip stitches too tightly.
BOOTIE (make 2)
Ch 19, leaving a long tail for sewing.
First Side
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch to end of row. Turn. 18 sc.
2nd to 18th rows:  Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Do not fasten off at end of last row.
Toe Inset
1st row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 hdc in each of first 9 sts. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. 9 hdc.
2nd to 11th rows: Ch 1. *1 hdc-slip into horizontal bar created below st in previous row (bar is below loops normally worked on WS – see diagram). Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
Do not fasten off at end of last row.
Second Side
1st row: (RS). Ch 10. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each of next 8 ch. 1 sc in in each of next 9 sc. 18 sc.
2nd to 18th rows:  Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Fasten off, leaving an 18-20" [45.5-51 cm] tail for seaming.
FINISHING
Fold Bootie in half. With beg tail, sew heel seam. With ending tail, sew sole seam then (continuing with ending tail), weave tail through ends of rows at toe and pull tightly to form toe and close opening. Weave in ends.
